hackathon-description-text: Sharing is one of the few ideas we can all access - something that directly affects our day-to-day lives. The more technology we build to share our moments, perspectives, and lives, the better equipped we are to engage and redefine the human experience.
hackathon-requirements: All current high school and university students who have been accepted by the sign up process through
hackathon-rules: Our hackathon is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, previous hackathon attendance or computing experience (or lack of any of the aforementioned). We do not tolerate harassment of hackathon participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate at any hackathon venue, including hacks, talks, workshops, parties, social media and other online media. Hackathon participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the hackathon without a refund (if applicable) at the discretion of the hackathon organisers.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: First Place winners for best overall hack will receive a Dell Tablet and a set of Audio-Technica Professional Headphones.
Second Place winners for best overall hack will receive a Fujifilm Instax and a Holy Stone Mini Quadcopter.
Third Place winners for best overall hack will receive an Amazon Kindle Paperwhite.
DSLR Cameras and Custom Skateboards for each member of the winning team, valued at $500 USD each.
Accelerator Centre will award its AC Pathfinder Market Validation Program to teams that develop exciting ideas with the potential to become valuable companies.
indico will award $1,000 in indico API credit to each member of the winning team which makes best use of indico API, the more creative the better!
The team with the best domain name will receive swag bags containing Sparkfun Redboards on behalf of Domain.com
The team that creates the best tools for their developers will receive Octocat Statues on behalf of GitHub
1 TB external hard drives for the best use of Amazon Web Services in your hack!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Amazon Web Services

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=251 Dundas St, London, ON N6A 6H9, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is your hack unique or does it touch on unexplored territory?
Does your hack have potential to create a widespread social or industry impact?
Does your hack draws on our theme of “sharing” in a meaningful way?
Does your hack demonstrate a creative application of technical ability?

hackathon-location-address: 251 Dundas St, London, ON N6A 6H9, Canada
